rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Dr. TR is one of the most amazing professors I've had. Not only has she taught me the art and subtle nuances of a superior writing style, her class is wonderfully entertaining and something I look forward to. I've gained invaluable knowledge from her and will miss being her student. She's understanding and reasonable and will always support you.
This was an excellent introduction to the policy and history behind the U.S. health care system. Simply put, the curriculum and teacher were nonpareil.

This professor does not prepare for class, shows up late for class and keeps students late, assigns excessive/irrelevant readings and does not discuss them, and has certain favorite students but takes pride in belittling other students. Her hubris is extremely off-putting.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Very unclear and always changing assignments.  Expects above average writing skills and knowing APA format is essential. Slow to respond to emails and to return grades.

Comes to UNC after having worked as a county health department director in Florida and brings this experience to class.  There is a bit of reading and the class begins quickly. Reading though is interesting. Largest challenge is group work. Be sure all group members are clear on expectations. Overall enjoyable class.
Cheryll is the most unhelpful advisor and is demeaning. I would advise if you get assigned to her, please switch to another advisor as soon as possible.

Cheryll is a very educated and passionate person but expects far too much from her distance MPH students. The amount of discussion posts that she expects is different from her syllabus and is very picky about when you post things which reflect your grade entirely. She needs to chill out and understand we have lives!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Guest speakers from different aspects of public health come in and talk about their fields. At the end of the semester, you write a paper about a public health issue for pass/fail. Very inspirational and I would recommend it to anyone interested in a health profession!

Dr. Yeatt's taught a one-credit hour seminar course called "Exploring Public Health" that was amazing! Guest speakers came in and talked to us every week and it was fascinating to hear them talk about their experiences in public health. If you have an interest in public health be sure to take one of her introductory courses!
I found the class pretty easy. Dr. Yeatts is a great epidemiologist and does a good job of exposing her students to real epidemiology work through class examples and the lab assignments.

Dr. Yeatts is very kind and very intelligent. I thoroughly enjoyed her class. While lectures could seem rather redundant, the lab component of Epid 600 was very useful and interactive. Dr. Yeatts always gave prompt, clear feedback whenever I emailed with a question. I enjoyed taking this class, and would like to further my learning of Epid 600.
